desc: The Baseball Bat swings intuitively and easily, delivering a solid blow
name: Baseball Bat

desc: The lighter alternative to the Lebel 1886, the Berthier Mle 1892 is a bolt-action mousqueton that doesn't lose power for the sake of its convenience.
name: Berthier Mle 1892

desc: The light Berthier Mle 1892 is a bolt-action mousqueton that doesn't lose power for the sake of its convenience. An affixed bayonet makes this deadly in close combat.
name: Berthier Mle 1892 Riposte

desc: The light Berthier Mle 1892 is a bolt-action mousqueton that doesn't lose power for the sake of its convenience. A Deadeye scope complements its performance at midrange.
name: Berthier Mle 1892 Deadeye

desc: The Berthier Mle 1892 is a bolt-action mousqueton that doesn't lose power for the sake of its convenience, A Marksman scope gives the rifle an advantage at distance.
name: Berthier Mle 1892 Marksman

desc: Adapted for combat on land, this explosive harpoon can be fired short distances and deals tremendous damage on direct impact.
name: Bomb Lance

desc: This early German semi-automatic pistol can release a hail of accurate fire by virtue of its low recoil. Reloads via a five-round magazine, or by topping up rounds individually. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Bornheim No. 3

desc: This early German semi-automatic pistol can release a hail of accurate fire by virtue of its low recoil. Modified to increase capacity by removing the option to reload via magazine. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Bornheim No. 3 Extended

desc: This early German semi-automatic pistol can reliably put down targets at a distance, making use of its low recoil and fast reload.
name: Bornheim No. 3 Match

desc: This early German semi-automatic pistol can release a hail of accurate fire by virtue of its low recoil. An attached silencer masks the rapid gunfire. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Bornheim No. 3 Silencer

desc: Fast, light, and easy to handle, this double-action revolver has a distinguished counter-clockwise rotating cylinder that swings out to effortlessly reload its six .38 bullets. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Caldwell 92 New Army

desc: Faster reloading Caldwell 92 New Army pistol, thanks to a speed reloader. However, any unspent ammunition is lost in the process of reloading. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Caldwell 92 New Army Swift

desc: The Caldwell Conversion Pistol is a single-action six-shot revolver. Slow to reload but sturdy and reliable. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Caldwell Conversion Pistol

desc: Modified single-action revolver that chambers 17 rounds in a revolving chain for sustained fire. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Caldwell Conversion Chain Pistol

desc: Modified single-action revolver that fires more powerful rifle cartridges, but kicks like a mule. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Caldwell Conversion Uppercut

desc: Modified single-action revolver, with a stock to stabilize its powerful rifle cartridges.
name: Caldwell Conversion Uppercut Precision

desc: Fast-firing pump-action rifle that performs best at mid-range. A clunky reload reduces its flexibility.
name: Caldwell Marathon

desc: Fast-firing pump-action rifle that performs best at mid-range. Reloading is quickened with a speed loader mechanism.
name: Caldwell Marathon Swift

desc: This iconic single-action six round revolver needs no further introduction. Robust, powerful, and accurate, it brought peace to the once lawless West. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Caldwell Pax

desc: Iconic single-action six round revolver. Robust, powerful, and accurate, a blade affixed to the grip gives this an edge up close. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Caldwell Pax Claw

desc: The iconic single-action six round revolver with an extended barrel that increases muzzle velocity. Robust, exceptionally powerful, and fairly accurate, it is the arm of the West's spreading law. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Caldwell Pax Trueshot

desc: Sturdy, break-action, side-by-side shotgun with a medium-length barrel that can destroy all but the toughest targets at close range.
name: Caldwell Rival 78

desc: Sawn-off break-action side-by-side shotgun. Its wider spread but shorter range make this a great backup weapon.
name: Caldwell Rival 78 Handcannon

desc: Regulation cavalry saber in use since the Civil War. Lightweight with good reach.
name: Cavalry Saber

desc: A heavy two-handed melee weapon that can split open the toughest of enemies with ease.
name: Combat Axe

desc: Hand-crafted crossbow that fires powerful bolts. Well suited for covert missions and stealth takedowns, but has a long reload. Bolts can be retrieved and reused.
name: Crossbow

desc: Prototype long-barreled semi-automatic shotgun with internal four round magazine plus one in the chamber. High power and rate of fire, but strong recoil and short range.
name: Crown & King Auto-5

desc: Powerful, German, prototype, semi-automatic pistol with an internal magazine loaded from the top. When fully emptied, it can be reloaded fast with a ten-round stripper clip. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Dolch 96

desc: The German, prototype, semi-automatic pistol, with a robust hooked blade affixed for hand-to-hand combat. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Dolch 96 Claw

desc: The German, prototype, semi-automatic pistol with a short scope to fully utilize the weapon's power at midrange. Cannot use a stripper clip to be reloaded. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Dolch 96 Deadeye

desc: Powerful, German, prototype, semi-automatic pistol. The wooden holster is attached as a makeshift buttstock for accurate fire over distance.
name: Dolch 96 Precision

desc: Two medium rifle barrels combined with a shotgun underbarrel to create an all-round flexible and powerful weapon.
name: Drilling

desc: Two medium rifle barrels combined with a shotgun underbarrel, all three shortened to make a small sloter, more compact package.
name: Drilling Handcannon

desc: Two medium rifle barrels combined with a shotgun underbarrel and an additional blade to create a powerful multipurpose weapon.
name: Drilling Hatchet

desc: Imaginative hand crossbow that fires compact bolts. Excels in situations when discretion is required above all. Bolts can be retrieved and reused.
name: Hand Crossbow

desc: Able to pierce through flesh and bone at a great distance, the Hunting Bow will make quick, stealthy work of monsters and men. Arrows can be retrieved and reused.
name: Hunting Bow

desc: A two-handed sword refined over hundreds of years to slice and pierce even the sturdiest armor, making human flesh effortless to rend. Special attack enabled with Martialist Trait.
name: Katana

desc: Infamous icon of the Confederacy, this updated model takes nine cartridges in its cylinder. Its second barrel delivers a shotgun blast up close. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: LeMat Mark II

desc: The LeMat Mark II's unique design that featured an extra shotgun barrel made it very effective in close quarters. This model transforms it into a rifle with a stock and extended barrel, improving its overall handling & power
name: LeMat Mark II Carbine

desc: The LeMat Mark II Carbine's extended barrel, shotgun barrel, and rifle stock make it a very fine weapon for combat at almost any range when combined with a marksman scope.
name: LeMat Mark II Carbine Marksman

desc: Two-handed advancement on the LeMat Mark II that trades speed for power, and uses Long Ammo.
name: LeMat Mark II UpperMat

desc: The Lebel 1886, groundbreaking for its time, is a bolt-action rifle with an internal 10-round magazine. Slightly outperformed by more modern designs, it remains a powerful weapon of choice.
name: Lebel 1886

desc: The groundbreaking Lebel 1886 bolt-action rifle with a toggle-able Aperture sight which ensures higher precision at medium ranges.
name: Lebel 1886 Aperture

desc: A version of the Lebel 1886 bolt-action rifle with a mounted medium scope that ensures higher accuracy at a distance.
name: Lebel 1886 Marksman

desc: This variant of the Lebel 1886 bolt-action rifle doubles as a deadly melee weapon thanks to the axe blade attached to the buttstock.
name: Lebel 1886 Talon

desc: Used both for cutting through undergrowth and limbs, a machete is a reliable weapon to forge a path.
name: Machete

desc: Long range, lever-action rifle that delivers a powerful punch with long ammo. From a new manufacturer in competition with Winfield.
name: Mako 1895 Carbine

desc: Long range, lever-action rifle that delivers a powerful punch with long ammo. Its toggle-able Aperture sight ensures higher precision at medium ranges.
name: Mako 1895 Carbine Aperture

desc: Long range, lever-action rifle that delivers a powerful punch with long ammo. A robust hooked blade is affixed to make the gun a melee and ranged weapon.
name: Mako 1895 Carbine Claw

desc: The workhorse rifle of the British Empire, the Martini-Henry IC1 is a single-shot breech-loading rifle that values simplicity and power.
name: Martini-Henry IC1

desc: This single-shot breech-loading rifle is furnished with a Deadeye scope that complements its competent range and power.
name: Martini-Henry IC1 Deadeye

desc: This Martini-Henry IC1 features a mechanism carrying five extra cartridges in addition to the one in the rifle's chamber which allows the wielder to replace the spent cartridge in quick succession, transforming the weapon.
name: Martini-Henry IC1 Ironside

desc: This single-shot breech-loading rifle is furnished with a Marksman's scope that complements its competent range and power.
name: Martini-Henry IC1 Marksman

desc: This experimental conversion of a bolt-action rifle was modified into a makeshift machine gun, with a high rate of fire and increased internal magazine. Reloaded with stripper clips.
name: Mosin-Nagant M1891 Avtomat

desc: Modern Imperial Russian bolt-action service rifle with an internal magazine. Its attached spike bayonet turns it into a frightening melee weapon.
name: Mosin-Nagant M1891 Bayonet

desc: Sawn-off variant of the Mosin-Nagant bolt-action rifle. Can be carried as a backup weapon that packs a punch, but without a stock its recoil is brutal.
name: Mosin-Nagant M1891 Obrez

desc: This shortened Russian service rifle is outfitted with an extended Drum magazine, giving it a huge capacity for ammunition.
name: Mosin-Nagant M1891 Obrez Drum

desc: This shortened Russian service rifle has been additionally modified with a weighted 'mace' stock, making it a competent melee weapon.
name: Mosin-Nagant M1891 Obrez Mace

desc: Modern Imperial Russian bolt-action service rifle. The attached long scope provides accuracy at range, but prevents the use of stripper clips for fast reloading.
name: Mosin-Nagant M1891 Sniper

desc: Modern, Imperial Russian, single-action revolver. Slow to reload. Sacrifices stopping power for an extra bullet in the drum and a higher rate of fire. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Nagant M1895

desc: Modern, Imperial Russian, double-action revolver. Though it has a faster rate of fire, the stronger force required to pull the trigger has a negative impact on accuracy. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Nagant M1895 Officer

desc: Modern, Imperial Russian, double-action revolver variant. The weight of this piece is put to good use with an integrated knuckle duster. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Nagant M1895 Officer Brawler

desc: Modern, Imperial Russian, double-action revolver variant. This model is heavily modified with a longer barrel and a stock, effectively turning it into a small slot rapid-fire rifle.
name: Nagant M1895 Officer Carbine

desc: Modern, Imperial Russian, double-action revolver variant. This model is modified with a lengthened barrel and stock, as well as the addition of a telescopic sight, effectively turning it into an unconventional rapid-fire rifle.
name: Nagant M1895 Officer Carbine Deadeye

desc: Modern, Imperial Russian, single-action revolver. The attached stock improves accuracy and handling, making it easier to operate the hammer between shots at a faster rate.
name: Nagant M1895 Precision

desc: Modified, Russian, single-action, seven-round revolver. Telescopic sight and rifle stock make it an unconventional sniper.
name: Nagant M1895 Precision Deadeye

desc: Modern, Imperial Russian, single-action revolver. Unique among revolvers of this era. The cylinder gas seal suppresses the sound of its fire. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Nagant M1895 Silencer

desc: Powerful, side-by-side, big game hunting rifle that can bring down the large slotst targets at mid-range. Carries limited ammunition.
name: Nitro Express Rifle

desc: large slot mallet designed to hammer railroad spikes into their tracks, repurposed to hammer heads into the dirt.
name: Railroad Hammer

desc: Classic break-action shotgun with a long barrel. Good range and power for a shotgun. Has to reload after every shot.
name: Romero 77

desc: A Romero 77 shotgun with an external magazine and reloading device. Holds up to five shells at a time, including the one in the chamber, and allows for a seamless reload, making this a suitable repeating shotgun.
name: Romero 77 Alamo

desc: Heavily modified, break-action, single barrel shotgun. Sawn-off and tooled up with additional blades for brutal close combat.
name: Romero 77 Hatchet

desc: Classic break-action shotgun with a long barrel. Decent power, range, and attached blades for close combat make this a very flexible weapon to bring along.
name: Romero 77 Talon

desc: A classic, single-action break open revolver, the Scottfield has seen both sides of the law. The break action allows for quicker ejecting of spent rounds, meaning a faster overall reload when empty. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Scottfield Model 3

desc: This snub barrel Scottfield Model 3 not only has the quick reload Hunters have come to know, but an added pair of dusters for close combat at the cost of accuracy. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Scottfield Model 3 Brawler

desc: The buttstock on this Scottfield Model 3 allows for a more stable shot with steady aim and less kickback.
name: Scottfield Model 3 Precision

desc: Its shortened barrel makes the Scottfield Model 3 Spitfire a perfect choice for situations that require discretion, and its modified finger rest provides higher rate of fire in exchange for accuracy. Can be used for dual wielding.
name: Scottfield Model 3 Spitfire

desc: The Scottfield Model 3 Swift allows for an even quicker reload with the help of a device that lets the wielder load six cartridges together into the empty cylinder. However, any unspent ammunition is lost in the process of reloading.
name: Scottfield Model 3 Swift

desc: Renowned, large slot-bore, single-shot rifle with good sights. Can put down a bison across a prairie.
name: Sparks LRR

desc: Renowned, large slot-bore single shot rifle modified with a silencer.
name: Sparks LRR Silencer

desc: Renowned, large slot-bore, single-shot rifle mounted with a long scope for even greater effectiveness over distance.
name: Sparks LRR Sniper

desc: A Sparks LRR cut down to be a small slot handgun, the Sparks Pistol delivers equally powerful shots over short to medium ranges. Though small slot and easy to carry, it loses its power drastically over longer distances, and has a stronger recoil because of the missing stock.
name: Sparks Pistol

desc: Revolutionary pump-action shotgun with long barrel, able to fire shells in rapid succession. Reloading the internal magazine takes time, due to its clunky, unrefined loading sequence.
name: Specter 1882

desc: Rapid firing, pump-action shotgun with medium barrel. Tooled up with sharp knife bayonet for close combat.
name: Specter 1882 Bayonet

desc: A breech-loading rifle with a .50-70 caliber centerfire cartridge, the Springfield 1866 is best known for its quick rate of fire.
name: Springfield 1866

desc: The original breech-loading Springfield 1866 with bayonet attachment, a powerful short-range addition.
name: Springfield 1866 Bayonet

desc: A shorter version of the classic breech-loading rifle with .50-70 caliber centerfire cartridges and a quick fire rate. Its sawn-off barrel and stock make the weapon hard to control, but a great backup.
name: Springfield 1866 Compact
Specter 1882 Compact
desc: Sawn-off, rapid firing, pump-action shotgun. While sacrificing accuracy and ammo capacity, the added foregrip keeps recoil under control in close quarter combat.

name: Springfield 1866 Compact Deadeye
desc: Because of its compact size and mid-range scope, this rifle is considered the 'pocket sniper' of the Springfield line.

name: Springfield 1866 Compact Striker
desc: A shorter, close-combat version of the classic breech-loading rifle with .50-70 caliber centerfire cartridges and a quick fire rate. The knife attached to its barrel can be used for both heavy and light melee attacks.

name: Springfield 1866 Marksman
desc: A shorter, scoped version of the classic breech-loading rifle with .50-70 caliber centerfire cartridges, quick fire rate, and stock. The scope is ideal to aid long-range shots.

name: Springfield M1892 Krag
desc: The Springfield M1892 Krag is a bolt-action rifle that holds five rounds in its internal magazine, and one in its chamber. Its magazine lid allows the wielder to top it up from the side, without opening the bolt, and ejecting the round.

name: Springfield M1892 Krag Bayonet
desc: The easy-reloading Springfield M1892 Krag bolt-action rifle, with bayonet attached for close quarters combat.

name: Springfield M1892 Krag Sniper
desc: The original repeating, bolt-action Springfield M1892 Krag with a sniper scope attached to it, making the rifle even more efficient over longer ranges.

name: Vetterli 71 Karabiner
desc: Swiss military, bolt-action carbine with internal magazine. Powerful at medium distances. Reloading is inspired by the Winfield repeater rifle, making it easy to top up ammunition.

name: Vetterli 71 Karabiner Bayonet
desc: Swiss military, bolt-action carbine with internal magazine. The attached bayonet makes this a great choice for close combat.

name: Vetterli 71 Karabiner Cyclone
desc: Swiss military, semi-automatic carbine with a reduced internal magazine to compensate for its self-loading mechanism. Powerful at medium distances.

name: Vetterli 71 Karabiner Deadeye
desc: Swiss military, bolt-action carbine with internal magazine. A short scope makes this weapon very effective at longer ranges.

name: Vetterli 71 Karabiner Marksman
desc: Swiss military, bolt-action carbine with internal magazine. The attached medium scope makes this excel at a distance.

name: Vetterli 71 Karabiner Silencer
desc: Swiss military, bolt-action carbine with internal magazine. The attached silencer makes this ideal for stealth.

name: Winfield 1887 Terminus
desc: Seminal lever-action repeating shotgun. Boasting a balance between power and rate-of-fire, this became an icon of the era. Chamber 5+2 shells.

name: Winfield 1887 Terminus Handcannon
desc: Seminal sawn-off lever-action repeating shotgun. Shortened to reduce size and increase lethality at close range, this packs high power for its size. Chambers 4+2 shells.

name: Winfield 1893 Slate
desc: An exposed hammer shotgun that replaces lever-action with pump-action, this Winfield Model 93 holds several 12-gauge rounds to cause devastating damage to opponents.

name: Winfield 1893 Slate Riposte
desc: Exposed hammer, pump-action Winfield Model 93 shotgun with bayonet affixed for mastery of close quarter combat.

name: Winfield M1873
desc: Iconic repeating rifle with very large internal magazine, capable of firing compact bullets at rapid speed. Reload is very simple, making an ammo top-up a quick job.

name: Winfield M1873 Aperture
desc: Modified iconic repeating rifle with very large internal magazine. The aperture sight makes it easier to aim more precisely at medium ranges, and can be toggled.

name: Winfield M1873 Musket Bayonet
desc: An iconic repeating rifle with an enlarged internal magazine that is equipped to fire compact bullets at rapid speed. In combination with its increased length, the bayonet makes this a formidable weapon against any foe that gets too close.

name: Winfield M1873 Swift
desc: Modified iconic repeating rifle with very large internal magazine. Reloading is quickened with a speed loader mechanism.

name: Winfield M1873 Talon
desc: Modified iconic repeating rifle with very large internal magazine. The stock is mounted with blades for melee combat.

name: Winfield M1873C
desc: Lightened repeating rifle with demi-size internal magazine, capable of firing compact bullets at rapid speed.

name: Winfield M1873C Marksman
desc: Lightened repeating rifle with demi-size internal magazine, capable of firing compact bullets at rapid speed. Mounted with a medium scope for enhanced precision.

name: Winfield M1873C Silencer
desc: Lightened repeating rifle with demi-size internal magazine, capable of firing compact bullets at rapid speed. Comes with a silencer.

name: Winfield M1873C Vandal
desc: A shortened Winfield M1873C, fires compact bullets at rapid speed.

name: Winfield M1873C Vandal Deadeye
desc: A shortened Winfield M1873C, fires compact bullets at rapid speed. A Deadeye scope improves performance at midrange.

name: Winfield M1873C Vandal Striker
desc: A shortened Winfield M1873C, fires compact bullets at rapid speed. Attached blade makes it deadly in melee.

name: Winfield M1876 Centennial
desc: Powerful repeating rifle chambered for larger ammunition than previous models. The magazine holds 9 rounds.

name: Winfield M1876 Centennial Sniper
desc: Powerful repeating rifle with good stopping power and an attached scope, highly effective at long range. The magazine holds nine rounds.

name: Winfield M1876 Centennial Shorty
desc: This particular version of the Winfield M1876 Centennial is shortened for more dynamic shooting ability without sacrificing magazine capacity or firing power.

name: Winfield M1876 Centennial Shorty Silencer
desc: This particular version of the Winfield M1876 Centennial features a suppressor to mask the volume of the powerful repeating rifle.

name: Winfield M1876 Centennial Trauma
desc: This particular version of the Winfield M1876 Centennial features a reinforced stock that delivers a hit as heavy and deadly as a sledgehammer, which makes the rifle viable in melee combat.
